DataElement.preferredName: Prophylactic Cranial Irradiation Approach RT Administered Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the type of radiation therapy that will be used on a patient's head to reduce the risk that cancer will spread to the brain.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Prophylactic Cranial Irradiation Approach
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the radiation therapy treatment approach that will be used on the head to reduce the risk that cancer will spread to the brain.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: (pro-fih-LAK-tik KRAY-nee-ul ir-ray-dee-AY-shun) Radiation therapy to the head to reduce the risk that cancer will spread to the brain.:a way of entering or leaving.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy to the head to reduce the risk that cancer will spread to the brain.
A way of entering or leaving.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to NRG for by script Fri Jan 24 11:30:54 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of radiation therapy given to a patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation treatment in which the total dose of radiation is divided into small doses and treatments are given more than once a day.

Concepts.definition: Radiation treatments in which the total dose of radiation is divided into smaller doses and administered more than once a day.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy using photon beam.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy using photon beam.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of external radiation therapy that uses special equipment to position the patient and precisely give a single large dose of radiation to a tumor. It is used to treat brain tumors and other brain disorders that cannot be treated by regular surgery. It is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to treat cancer cells that use high energy beams.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3-D CRT.

Concepts.definition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy using electron beam.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy using electron beam.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A process by which a dose of radiation is automatically shaped to closely conform to the entire volume of the tumor, so that surrounding normal tissue is spared and treatment toxicity is decreased.

Concepts.definition: A process by which a dose of radiation is automatically shaped to closely conform to the entire volume of the tumor, so that surrounding normal tissue is spared and treatment toxicity is decreased.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of external beam radiation therapy using a beam of protons.  It has the advantage of precisely localizing the radiation dose on the targeted tissue and avoiding damage to the healthy surrounding tissues.

Concepts.definition: A type of external beam radiation therapy using a beam of protons. It has the advantage of precisely localizing the radiation dose on the targeted tissue and avoiding damage to the healthy surrounding tissues.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Use of light activated drugs (photosensitizing agents) to kill cancer cells.

Concepts.definition: Use of light activated drugs (photosensitizing agents) to treat cancer and other conditions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The use of electrodes to heat and destroy abnormal tissue.

Concepts.definition: Definition not available.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy that is administered subsequent to the main treatment plan to minimize or prevent disease recurrence.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy that is administered subsequent to the main treatment plan to minimize or prevent disease recurrence.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor.

Concepts.definition: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of radiation therapy that uses a machine to aim high-energy rays at the cancer from outside of the body.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Treatment given as a first step to shrink a tumor before the main treatment, which is usually surgery, is given. Examples of neoadjuvant therapy include chemotherapy, radiation therapy, and hormone therapy. It is a type of induction therapy.

Concepts.definition: Therapy administered prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any radiation treatment done with the intent to relieve symptoms and reduce the suffering caused by the cancer, and not with the intent of curing the cancer.

Concepts.definition: Any radiation treatment done with the intent to relieve symptoms and reduce the suffering caused by the cancer, and not with the intent of curing the cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A process by which a dose of radiation is automatically shaped to closely conform to the entire volume of the tumor, so that surrounding normal tissue is spared and treatment toxicity is decreased.

Concepts.definition: A process by which a dose of radiation is automatically shaped to closely conform to the entire volume of the tumor, so that surrounding normal tissue is spared and treatment toxicity is decreased.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3-D CRT.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A procedure that uses a computer to create a picture of a tumor to help guide the radiation beam during radiation therapy. The pictures are made using CT, ultrasound, X-ray, or other imaging techniques. Image-guided radiation therapy makes radiation therapy more accurate and causes less damage to healthy tissue.

Concepts.definition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

A procedure that uses a computer to create a picture of a tumor to help guide the radiation beam during radiation therapy. The pictures are made using CT, ultrasound, X-ray, or other imaging techniques. Image-guided radiation therapy makes radiation therapy more accurate and causes less damage to healthy tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A reduced quantity of a therapeutic agent prescribed to be taken at one time or at stated intervals.: (ray-dee-AY-shun) A procedure in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor. Also called brachytherapy, internal radiation, or interstitial radiation.: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy

Concepts.definition: A reduced quantity of a therapeutic agent prescribed to be taken at one time or at stated intervals.
A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.

An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Internal radiation treatment that targets a cancerous tissue with accurate, high doses of radiation through the use of inserted temporary implants._An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

Concepts.definition: Internal radiation treatment that targets a cancerous tissue with accurate, high doses of radiation through the use of inserted temporary implants.

An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: High-Dose Rate Brachytherapy 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: High-Dose Rate Brachytherapy 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Internal radiation treatment that targets a cancerous tissue with accurate, high doses of radiation through the use of inserted temporary implants.: A process by which a dose of radiation is automatically shaped to closely conform to the entire volume of the tumor, so that surrounding normal tissue is spared and treatment toxicity is decreased.

Concepts.definition: Internal radiation treatment that targets a cancerous tissue with accurate, high doses of radiation through the use of inserted temporary implants.
A process by which a dose of radiation is automatically shaped to closely conform to the entire volume of the tumor, so that surrounding normal tissue is spared and treatment toxicity is decreased.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Low-Dose Treatment Brachytherapy 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Low-Dose Treatment Brachytherapy 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A reduced quantity of a therapeutic agent prescribed to be taken at one time or at stated intervals.: (ray-dee-AY-shun) A procedure in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor. Also called brachytherapy, internal radiation, or interstitial radiation.: A process by which a dose of radiation is automatically shaped to closely conform to the entire volume of the tumor, so that surrounding normal tissue is spared and treatment toxicity is decreased. (from Varian Oncology web site)

Concepts.definition: A reduced quantity of a therapeutic agent prescribed to be taken at one time or at stated intervals.
A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.
A process by which a dose of radiation is automatically shaped to closely conform to the entire volume of the tumor, so that surrounding normal tissue is spared and treatment toxicity is decreased.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of external beam radiation therapy in which the radiation is delivered slice-by-slice, providing sequential delivery of radiation to different parts of the tumor. This method differs from other forms of radiation therapy in which the entire tumor volume is irradiated at one time.

Concepts.definition: A type of external beam radiation therapy in which the radiation is delivered slice-by-slice, providing sequential delivery of radiation to different parts of the tumor. This method differs from other forms of radiation therapy in which the entire tumor volume is irradiated at one time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A process by which a dose of radiation is automatically shaped to closely conform to the entire volume of the tumor, so that surrounding normal tissue is spared and treatment toxicity is decreased.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A modification of intensity modulated radiation therapy that allows for the simultaneous delivery of different dose levels to different target volumes within a single treatment fraction. This can result in better sparing of critical structures, more efficient delivery, shorter treatment duration, and better biologic effectiveness.

Concepts.definition: A process by which a dose of radiation is automatically shaped to closely conform to the entire volume of the tumor, so that surrounding normal tissue is spared and treatment toxicity is decreased.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

A modification of intensity modulated radiation therapy that allows for the simultaneous delivery of different dose levels to different target volumes within a single treatment fraction. This can result in better sparing of critical structures, more efficient delivery, shorter treatment duration, and better biologic effectiveness.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A proprietary, robotic radiosurgery system designed to deliver precise beams of high does radiation to tumors with extreme accuracy.

Concepts.definition: A proprietary, robotic radiosurgery system designed to deliver precise beams of high dose radiation to tumors with extreme accuracy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The property of being measured and described using two orthogonal directions.

Concepts.definition: The property of being measured and described using two orthogonal directions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A machine that creates high-energy radiation to treat cancer, using electricity to form a stream of fast-moving subatomic particles.  Also called mega-voltage (MeV) linear accelerator or a linac.

Concepts.definition: A type of particle accelerator that generates ionizing radiation by colliding subatomic particles traveling at high speeds along a straight chamber. This creates high-energy radiation that may be used to treat cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of external radiation therapy that uses special equipment to position the patient and precisely give a single large dose of radiation to a tumor. It is used to treat brain tumors and other brain disorders that cannot be treated by regular surgery. It is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.

Concepts.definition: A non-surgical procedure that was developed to deliver one or several maximum dose targeted radiation treatments for cancers in the brain or spine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Something regarded as a normative example.: A type of radiation therapy that uses a machine to aim high-energy rays at the cancer from outside of the body.

Concepts.definition: Something regarded as a normative example.
Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Supplying or being a final or conclusive settlement or result.

Concepts.definition: Supplying or being a final or conclusive settlement or result.

The pictures are made using CT, ultrasound, X-ray, or other imaging techniques. Image-guided radiation therapy makes radiation therapy more accurate and causes less damage to healthy tissue.: Radiation treatment in which the total dose of radiation is divided into large doses and treatments are given less than once a day.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that uses a computer to create a picture of a tumor to help guide the radiation beam during radiation therapy. The pictures are made using CT, ultrasound, X-ray, or other imaging techniques. Image-guided radiation therapy makes radiation therapy more accurate and causes less damage to healthy tissue.
Radiation treatment in which the total dose of radiation is divided into large doses and treatments are given less than once a day.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.: Surgical removal of the breast.: Radiation treatment in which the total dose of radiation is divided into large doses and treatments are given less than once a day.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Surgical removal of the breast.
Radiation treatment in which the total dose of radiation is divided into large doses and treatments are given less than once a day.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A currently accepted and widely used treatment for a certain type of disease, based on the results of past research.: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.: Surgical removal of the breast.: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: A currently accepted and widely used treatment for a certain type of disease, based on the results of past research.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Surgical removal of the breast.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation treatment modality used as major component in treatment of primary and metastatic brain tumors. This is a standard treatment for multiple brain metastases.

Concepts.definition: Radiation treatment modality used as major component in treatment of primary and metastatic brain tumors. This is a standard treatment for multiple brain metastases.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stereotactic radiation therapy that uses multiple, smaller doses of radiation therapy spread over several treatment session.

Concepts.definition: Stereotactic radiation therapy that uses multiple doses of radiation spread over several treatment session.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
